summary: This bill, the Sunshine Protection Act of 2025, aims to make daylight saving time permanent in the United States. It repeals the existing provision for temporary daylight saving time and modifies the Uniform Time Act of 1966. It also includes provisions for states and areas that have previously exempted themselves from daylight saving time, allowing them to choose whether to observe standard time or daylight saving time year-round. The bill was introduced in the Senate by Senator Scott of Florida and co-sponsored by several other senators.
